intro: Fumaria purpurea, commonly known as the purple flameflower, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers. The flowers are typically a striking combination of purple and yellow, with a distinctive, smoky appearance. The plant produces elongated, cylindrical seed pods that split open to release tiny seeds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas or along stream banks.
